content.text:
# 6th Goya Awards

The 6th Goya Awards were presented in Madrid on 7 March 1992.
Amantes won the award for Best Film.
Winners and nominees
Major award nominees
{| class=wikitable style="width="100%"
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Film}}
*' Lovers '
**Don Juan in Hell
**The Dumbfounded King
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Director}}
*' Vicente Aranda – Lovers '
**Pilar Miró – Prince of Shadows
**Imanol Uribe – The Dumbfounded King
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Actor}}
*' Fernando Guillén – Don Juan in Hell '
**Gabino Diego – The Dumbfounded King
**Jorge Sanz – Lovers
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Actress}}
*' Sílvia Munt – Butterfly Wings '
**Victoria Abril – Lovers
**Maribel Verdú – Lovers
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Supporting Actor}}
*' Juan Diego – The Dumbfounded King '
**José Luis Gómez – Prince of Shadows
**Javier Gurruchaga – The Dumbfounded King
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Supporting Actress}}
*' Kiti Manver – Anything for Bread '
**María Barranco – The Dumbfounded King
**Cristina Marcos – High Heels
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Original Screenplay}}
*' Butterfly Wings – Eduardo Bajo Ulloa and Juanma Bajo Ulloa '
**Anything for Bread – Luis Marías
**Lovers – Álvaro del Amo, Vicente Aranda and Carlos Pérez Merinero
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Adapted Screenplay}}
*' The Dumbfounded King'' – Joan Potau and Gonzalo Torrente Malvido
**' – Carmen Rico-Godoy
**Prince of Shadows – Mario Camus, Pilar Miró and Juan Antonio Porto
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best New Director}}
*' Juanma Bajo Ulloa – Butterfly Wings''
**Ana Belén – '
**Manuel Gómez Pereira – Pink Sauce
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Spanish Language Foreign Film}}
*' The Frontier • Chile '
**Hello Hemingway • Cuba
**Jericó • Venezuela
**A Matter of Honour • Colombia
|}
Other award nominees
{| class=wikitable style="width="100%"
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Cinematography}}
*' Prince of Shadows – Javier Aguirresarobe '
**Don Juan in Hell – Carlos Suárez
**The Dumbfounded King – Hans Burman
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Editing}}
*' Prince of Shadows – José Luis Matesanz '
**High Heels – José Salcedo
**Lovers – Teresa Font
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Art Direction}}
*' The Dumbfounded King – Félix Murcia '
**Don Juan in Hell – Wolfgang Burmann
**Prince of Shadows – Fernando Sáenz and Luis Vallés
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Production Supervision}}
*' The Dumbfounded King – Andrés Santana '
**Don Juan in Hell – Alejandro Vázquez
**Prince of Shadows – José L. García Arrojo
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Sound}}
*' The Dumbfounded King – Gilles Ortion and Ricard Casals '
**Prince of Shadows – Carlos Faruolo, Manuel Cora and Alberto Herena
**High Heels – Jean-Paul Mugel
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Special Effects}}
*' Prince of Shadows – Reyes Abades '
**Anything for Bread – Kit West
**' – Carlo De Marchis
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Costume Design}}
* The Dumbfounded King – Javier Artiñano '
**Don Juan in Hell – Yvonne Blake
**High Heels – José María Cossío
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Makeup and Hairstyles}}
*' The Dumbfounded King – Romana González and Josefa Morales '
**High Heels – Jesús Moncusi and Gregorio Ros
**Prince of Shadows – Juan Pedro Hernández
|-
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Original Score}}
*' The Dumbfounded King – José Nieto '
**Anything for Bread – Bernardo Bonezzi
**Don Juan in Hell – Alejandro Massó
| style="vertical-align:top;" width="50%"||Best Short Film}}
*' La viuda negra '
**Eduardo
**La doncella virtuosa
**Ni contigo ni sin ti''
|}
Honorary Goya
* Emiliano Piedra
